intro: Dasystephana scabra, commonly known as the rough-stemmed dasystephana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its rough, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
